question_text: Calculate the time taken for a mango fruit that fall from the tree 20 m to the ground [g = 10 ms-2]
subject: physics
explanation: u = , H = 20, g = 10From equation of motion under gravityH = ut ± \(\frac{1}{2}\)gt2, It is falling so g is +veH = 0 + \(\frac{1}{2}\)gt2H = \(\frac{1}{2}\)gt22H = gt2\(\frac{2H}{g}\) = t2t = \(\frac{\sqrt{2H}}{g}\) = \(\frac{\sqrt {2 \times 20}}{10}\)= √4= 2s

question_text: Which of the following is not a mechanical wave?
subject: physics
explanation: Mechanical waves require material medium for their propagation only radio waves among the options docs require a material medium

question_text: The velocity ratio of an inclined plane where angle of inclination in θ is
subject: physics
explanation: Consider an inclined plane shown below, as the effort moves along OB, the load moves is lifted up through a vertical height ABV.R = \(\frac{\text{distance moved by effort}}{\text{distance moved by load}}\)  =  \(\frac{OB}{AB}\)But Sinθ = \(\frac{opp}{hyp}\) = \(\frac{AB}{OB}\)therefore; = \(\frac{OB}{AB}\) = \(\frac{1}{\sin \theta}\)

question_text: The volume of a fixed mass of gas is 10cm3 when its pressure is 400cmHg. Determine the volume of the gas when its pressure is 200cmHg.
subject: physics
explanation: Using boyle's lawP1V1 = P2V2V2 = \(\frac{P_1 V_1}{200}\) = \(\frac{400 \times 10}{200}\)= 20cm3

question_text: Which of the following representations is correct for an atom X with 28 electrons and 30 neutrons?
subject: physics
explanation: An atom can be represented thus,\(^{Z}_{A}X\)  where Z = mass numberA = atomic numberA = number of proton = number of electrons in a free state = 28Z = number of protons + number of neutrons = 28 + 30 = 58\(^{58}_{28}X\)is the representation

question_text: When two mirrors are placed at an angle of 900 to each other, how many images will be formed when an object is placed in front of the mirrors
subject: physics
explanation: When two mirror are inclined at an angle θ, the number of images formed, n = \(\frac{360}{\theta}\) − 1∴ since \(\theta\) = 90o∴ \(\frac{360}{\theta}\) − 1= 4 − 1= 3

question_text: If silicon is doped with phosphorus, what type of semiconductor material will be formed?
subject: physics
explanation: When silicon is doped with a trivalent atom. A p-type semi-conductor will be formed when silicon is doped with a pentavalent atom such as arsenic, a n-type semi-conductor will be formedPhosphorous is a pentavalent element, so it will produce a o -type semi-conductor

question_text: Calculate the angle of minimum deviation of a 60o prism of a refractive index [sin-10.75 = 49o]
subject: physics
explanation: For a refractive index () = \(\frac{\sin\frac{1}{2} (A + D)}{\sin\frac{1}{2}A}\)D = angle of minimum deviationA  = refractive angle of  the prism1.5 =  \(\frac{\sin\frac{1}{2} (60 + D)}{\sin\frac{1}{2} \times 60}\)1.5 =   \(\frac{\sin\frac{1}{2} (60 + D)}{\sin 30}\)Sin \(\frac{1}{2}\) (60 + D) = 1.5 * Sin 30Sin \(\frac{1}{2}\) (60 + D) = 0.75\(\frac{1}{2}\)  (60 + D) = Sin-1 (0.75)but Sin-1 (0.75) = 49o\(\frac{1}{2}\) (60 + D) = 4960 + D = 2 * 49 = 98oD = 98o - 60oD = 38o

question_text: What is the cost of running seven 40 W lamps and five 80 W la mps for 12 hours of the electrical energy cost N7.00kWk?
subject: physics
explanation: Seven 40W lamps = 7 × 40 = 280WFive 80W lamps = 5 × 80 = 400WTotal power = 280W + 400W= 680W= \(\frac{680KW}{1000}\) = 0.68KWThe kilowatt hour = 0.68 KW × 12 hrs= 8.16 KWhCost is N 7 per KWhSo the cost of running them = 8.16KWh × N 7/KWh= 57.12

question_text: From the diagram above, calculate the total current in the circuit
subject: physics
explanation: V = IR from ohms lawI = \(\frac{V}{R}\)Since the resistance are in parallel\(\frac{1}{Reff}\) = \(\frac{1}{8}\) + \(\frac{1}{12}\) + \(\frac{1}{6}\)= \(\frac{2 + 3 + 6}{36}\)   = \(\frac{11}{36}\)Reff = \(\frac{36}{11}\) = 3.27I = I1 + I2 + I3= \(\frac{V}{Reff}\)= \(\frac{12}{3.27}\)= 3.669AI = 3.7A

subject: physics
explanation: A black solution is a better radiator of heat and allow a better absorber of heat.

question_text: What is the speed of a body vibrating at 50 cyclic per second
subject: physics
explanation: 1 cycle = 3600 = 2π rad∴ 50 cycle = 2 π rad × 50 = 100 πrad∴ = angular speed = 50 cycles per seconds = 100 π rads\(_{−1}\)

question_text: The action of blotting paper on ink is due to
subject: physics
explanation: Capillarity is the tendency of a liquid to rise or fall in a narrow tube and it explains why a blotting paper absorbs ink

question_text: A constant force of %n acts for a % seconds on a mass of 5kg initially at rest. Calculate the final momentum
subject: physics
explanation: Impulse = momentumImpulse = Force (f) × time (t)Momentum = mass (m) × velocity (v)∴ Ft = Final momentum - initial momentumFT = mv - muSince it is initially at rest u = 0∴ 5 × 5 = mv − m(0)25 = mv∴ Final momentum = 25kgms\(^{-1}\)

question_text: I. Refraction II. Interference III. Diffraction Which of the above properties are common to all waves?
subject: physics
explanation: Refraction, Interference and diffraction are all properties of waves

question_text: I. Refraction II. Interference III. DiffractionWhich of the above properties are common to all waves?
subject: physics
explanation: Refraction, Interference and diffraction are all properties of waves

question_text: Which of the following is correct about an electric cell?
subject: physics
explanation: About electric cellPrimary cells are used up gradually often the cells are use and it can't be rechargedSecondary cells or accumulated can be recharged and used for a long period of time and their main advantage is that they have low internal resistance

options.answer: Primary cell produces a large current for a long time
Secondary cell has a very high internal resistance
Primary cell has a very low internal resistance
Secondary cell has a very low internal resistance

question_text: Which of the following is a semiconductor
subject: physics
explanation: Semi-conductor have an elecctric conductivity intermediate in value between that of a pure metal and a good insulator. Silicon is an example

question_text: Which of the following is a scalar quantity?
subject: physics
explanation: Scalar quantity is a quantity with only magnitude, it has no directionTension, weight, impulse are vector quantities because they have direction. Mass is the only scalar quantity there

question_text: Determine the focal length of a thin converging lens if the power is 5.0 dioptres
subject: physics
explanation: Power of a lens = \(\frac{1}{f}\)f = focal lengthf = \(\frac{1}{p}\)= \(\frac{1}{5}\) = 0.2m

question_text: A string of length 5cm is extended by 0.04m when a load of 0.8kg is suspended at the end. How far will it extend if a force of 16N is applied? [g = 10ms\(^{-2}\)]
subject: physics
explanation: From Hoke's Law, F = ke, K = Constant of ForceFor he first case, Force = mg,= 0.8 × 10 = 8N∴ 8 = k × 0.04k = \(\frac{8}{0.04}\)= \(\frac{200N}{m}\)Since K is constantFor the second case, F = keF = 200 × e∴ e = \(\frac{F}{200}\)= \(\frac{16}{200}\)= 0.08m

question_text: How can energy loss be minimized through Eddy-current?
subject: physics
explanation: Eddy currents are produced by the varying flux cathode, the iron core of an equipment thus reducing efficiency due to power consumption. It can be reduced by laminating the core by breaking up the path of eddy current or by increasing the resistance of the coreUsage of insulated soft iron wire is to reduce hysteresis lossUsage of low resistance wire (thick wire) is to reduce I2R lossUsage of thick wire is to reduce leakage heat loss due to leakage of magnetic fluxThus the correct answer is to use high resistance wire or thin wire

options.answer: By using insulated soft iron wires

question_text: Which of the following operations can be used to convert an alternative current dynamo into a direct current dynamo
subject: physics
explanation: A d.c generator is one in which its current is allowed to flow in one direction even through it may vary in value an a.c generator can only be made to produce a d.c by replacing the two slip rings with a single split ring or commutator.

options.answer: number of turns in the coil is increased
strength of the field magnet is increased
slip rings are replaced with split ring cummutator
coil is wound on a soft iron armature

question_text: The net capacitance in the circuit above is
subject: physics
explanation: For capacitance i n parallel, 2µF and 2µF are in parallel, their equivalence is 2µF and 2µF = 4µFThe 4µF generated is now in series with the remaining 4µF.The net  capacitance for series connection is\(\frac{1}{C}\) = \(\frac{1}{4}\) + \(\frac{1}{4}\) = 1 + \(\frac{1}{4}\) = \(\frac{2}{4}\)C = \(\frac{4}{2}\) = 2µF

question_text: The instrument used to measure the pressure of a gas is
subject: physics
explanation: Barometer is used to measure atmosphere pressureThermometer is used to measure temperatureHygrometer is used to measure relative density of a liquidManometer is used to measure the pressure of a gas

question_text: A man of mass 50kg ascends a flight of stains 5m high in 5 seconds. If acceleration due to gravity is 10ms\(^{-2}\) the power expended is
subject: physics
explanation: Power is the time rate of doing worki.e power = \(\frac{\text{energy}}{\text{time}}\)Since energy = mgH∴ power = \(\frac{mgH}{t}\)= \(\frac{50 \times 10 \times 5}{t}\)= 500W

question_text: A radio station broadcast at a frequency of 600KHZ. If the speed of light in air is 3 × 108ms\(^{−1}\). Calculate the wavelength of the radio wave
subject: physics
explanation: V = fλλ = \(\frac{v}{f}\)= \(\frac{3 \times 10^8}{600 \times 10^3}\) = 500m= 5 × 102mN.B 600KHz Frequency = 600 × 103Hz

question_text: The S.I unit of moment of a force is
subject: physics
explanation: Moment of a force is the product of a force and the perpendicular distance from the line of action of the force Moment = force × distance= N × m= Nm

question_text: A block and tackle pulley arrangement has 6 pulleys in which an effort of 50N supports a load of 200N, calculate the efficiency of the machine
subject: physics

question_text: Calculate the light of the image formed by a pinhole camera of length 12cm used to photograph an object 60cm away from the hole and 70cm high
subject: physics
explanation: Magnification = \(\frac{\text{Length of camera}}{\text{distance of object from pin hole}}\)m = \(\frac{12}{60}\)= 0.2Also magnification m = \(\frac{\text{Height of image}}{\text{Height of object}}\)∴ Height of image = m × height of object= 0.2 × 70= 14cm

question_text: When two objects P and Q are supplied with the same quantity of heat, the temperature change in P is observed to be twice that of Q. The mass of P is half that of Q. The ratio of the specific heat capacity pf P to Q is
subject: physics
explanation: H = mcθHP = HQ, θP = 2θ,mP = \(\frac{1}{2}\)mQ∴ HP = mQCPθP, also HQ = mQCQθQSince HP = HQ∴ mPcPθP = mQcPθqPutting in the conditions\(\frac{1}{2}\)mQ × cP × 2θQ = mQ × θQ × cQ∴ cP = cQ\(\frac{C_p}{C_Q}\)= \(\frac{1}{1}\)= 1:1

question_text: When the r.m.s value of a source of electricity supply is given as 240v, it means that the peak value of the supply is
subject: physics
explanation: The relationship between the peak value and r.m.s value of electricity supply is given asV\(_{r.m.s}\) = \(\frac{V_o}{\sqrt{2}}\)where Vo = peak voltage∴ Vo = V\(_{r.m.s}\) × √2= 240 × √2= 339.5v= 340v

question_text: A block and tackle pulley arrangement has 6 pulleys in which an effort of 50N supports a load of 200N, calculate the efficiency of the machine
subject: physics
explanation: Efficiency = \(\frac{ma}{V.R}\) x \(\frac{100}{1}\)V.R = number of pulleys = 6ma = \(\frac{\text{Load}}{\text{Effort}}\)   =  \(\frac{200}{50}\)  =  4Effiecieny = \(\frac{4}{6}\) ×  100  =  66.67%

question_text: Three 3ω resistance are connected in parallel what is the equivalent resistance?
subject: physics
explanation: Resistor connected in a parallel have an equivalence given by\(\frac{1}{\text{Reff}}\) = \(\frac{1}{3}\) + \(\frac{1}{3}\) + \(\frac{1}{3}\)= \(\frac{1 + 1 + 1}{3}\) = \(\frac{3}{3}\) =  1Reff = 1ω

question_text: Which of the following instruments helps to maintain the correct humidity and temperature of a building?

explanation: Compressor is an instrument to supply air or other gas at increased pressureRefrigerator is an appliance to keep things coldAir blower is used to release airAir conditioner is used to remove heat and maintain a stable temperature in an occupied space

explanation: Thermal expansion of a solid is majorly advantageous in the use of bimetallic strip in the balance of a watch so as not to lose time

subject: physics
explanation: Cathode rays are produced in a discharge tube under Low pressure and high voltage

question_text: Under which of the following conditions is work done?
subject: physics
explanation: Work Is only done when an object is moved to a distance. The ans is C because the man pushed the table to a distance. The rest no work is done. Ans C

options.answer: A man supports a heavy food above his head with his hands
A boy climbs onto a table
A man pushes unto a table
A woman holds a pot of water

question_text: Calculate the specific latent heat of vaporization of steam of 1.13 x 106J pf heat energy is required to convert 15kg of it to water.
subject: physics
explanation: Latent Energy = mass(m) × specific latent heat (L)ε = mLL = ε/m\(\frac{E}{m}\)= \(\frac{1.13 \times 106}{15}\)= 7.53 × 104Jkg\(^{-1}\)

question_text: A cell of internal resistance 2 π supplies current to a 6 π resistor. The efficiency of the cell is
subject: physics
explanation: Internal resistance determine the maximum current that can be suppliedEfficiency = \(\frac{r}{R}\) × 100= \(\frca{2}{6}\) × 100= 33.3%

explanation: Molecules of matter are in constant motion and liquid is matter, so liquid is not stationary

Brownian motion is an evidence of particle nature of matter

question_text: Which is the incorrect formula for a body accelerating uniformly?
subject: physics
explanation: s =  \(\frac{1}{2}\)ut + at2 is a wrong equation, it should be s =  ut + \(\frac{1}{2}\)at2

question_text: Which of the following is not an electromagnetic radiation?
subject: physics
explanation: Electromagnetic waves do not require any material medium, but sound waves is a mechanical wave that require a material medium

question_text: Calculate the electric field intensity between two plates of potential difference 6.5V when separated by a distance of 35cm.
subject: physics
explanation: Electric Field Intensity (E) = \(\frac{v}{d}\)= \(\frac{\text{potential difference}}{\text{distance}}\)= \(\frac{6.5v}{35cm}\)= \(\frac{6.5}{35 \times 10^{- 2}}\)= 18.57NC\(^{-1}\)

question_text: Why do soldiers march disorderly while crossing a bridge?
subject: physics
explanation: Soldiers march disorderly while crossing a bridge to prevent resonance because when soldiers march in orderly manner across a bridge, they generate a rhythmic oscillation of wave out. The bridge and at a certain point, would start oscillation to the same rhym as that of the marching steps. This oscillation would reach a maximum peak when the bridge can no longer sustain its own strength and hence collapses. So for this reasons, soldier are ordered to march disorderly while crossing a bridge

options.answer: To prevent resonance on the bridge
To set the bridge into resonance
To make the b ridge collapse
To spread their weight evenly on the bridge

question_text: Calculate the upthrust on an object of volume 50cm3 which is immersed in liquid of density 103kgm-3 [g = 10ms-2]
subject: physics
explanation: Upthrust = change in weightdensity = \(\frac{\text{mass}}{\text{volume}}\)Mass of liquid displaced = Density of Liquid × Volume;= 103 × 50 × 10− 6m3= 0.05kg(Note that the volume of 50cm3 was converted to m3 by multiplying by 106) i.e 50cm3 = 50 × 10−6m3)Since mass displaced = 0.05kgUpthrust = mg = 0.05 × 10= 0.5N
